intro: Boehmeria austrina, commonly known as the Australian nettle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes many species of nettle. The plant is characterized by its hairy, serrated leaves and small greenish-white flowers. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks. Boehmeria austrina is known for its fibrous stems, which have been used historically for making textiles and paper.
